name: ADVANCED TOPICS IN WRIT: WRITING FOR RADIO

section.name: ADVANCED TOPICS IN WRIT: WRITING FOR RADIO
ADVANCED TOPICS IN WRIT: MAGAZINE JOURNALISM
ADVANCED TOPICS IN WRIT: THE ART OF EATING

values.comments:
This course is designed to help students become a more effective and graceful writers, using food and the art of eating as the focus. The two central texts are: American Food Writing: An Anthology with Classic Recipes and The Gastronomical Me, by M.F.K. Fisher. 

 Students enjoyed the assigned readings, but felt the course was limited by the structure of the Critical Writing Program. 

 Professor Devaney was an “amazing” professor, but one student wished for more feedback earlier on in the course. Professor Devaney was, however, available to meet with students outside of class and later on provided more constructive feedback.  

Students wished there was a bit more “freedom” surrounding topics they could cover, and there was some confusion over assignment due dates.
